snippet: One of the two factions battling for control of Libya took steps to divert incoming oil revenue away from the Central Bank and into its own account in the United Arab Emirates.
abstract: Faction recognized internationally as Libya's official government issues directive for National Oil Company to stop depositing revenue into country's central bank and instead direct funds to its own bank account in United Arab Emirates; blatant move in battle over Libya's assets could precipitate clashes among country's various factions and may lead to breakup of bank or Western intervention.
lead_paragraph: One of the two factions battling for control of Libya took steps to divert incoming oil revenue away from the Central Bank and into its own account in the United Arab Emirates.

headline.main: One of Libya’s Rival Governments Moves to Control Oil Revenue
headline.print_headline: One of Libya’s Rival Governments Moves to Assert Control Over Its Oil Revenue
